title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 4. Regulation 3(1) of the Principal Regulations is hereby amended by the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3(1) of the Principal Regulations is hereby amended by the 

insertion of the following definition – 

“‘relevant functional area’ means the functional area of the Executive 
within the meaning of section 67 of the Health Act 2004 in which the 
applicant resides;”
text_norm: 4 regulation 3(1) principal regulation hereby amended insertion following definition - relevant functional area mean functional area executive within meaning section 67 health act 2004 applicant resides

text_raw:

insertion of “, which form shall identify the relevant functional area to which 
the application form is to be sent” after “published for that purpose by the 
Executive”.

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 6. Regulation 5 of the Principal Regulations is hereby amended by the
text_raw:

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 7. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the
text_raw:
7. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the 

following Regulation after Regulation 5 – 

“5A. For the purposes of Regulation 5 the processing of applications by 
the Executive means the receipt and recording of an application 
pursuant to section 9(1)(a) or (b) of the Act of 2005, together with the 
carrying out of all administrative steps required to be taken by the 
Executive pursuant to section 9 of the Act of 2005 up to the point that 
the Executive causes an assessment to be commenced.”
text_norm: 7 principal regulation hereby amended insertion following regulation regulation 5 - 5a purpose regulation 5 processing application executive mean receipt recording application pursuant section 9(1)(a) (b) act 2005 together carrying administrative step required taken executive pursuant section 9 act 2005 point executive cause assessment commenced

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 8. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the
text_raw:
8. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the 

following Regulation after Regulation 8 – 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [704] 3 

“8A. (1) Where the Executive causes an assessment of an applicant to 
be commenced, the Executive shall direct that the assessment is carried 
out within the relevant functional area. 
(2) In exceptional circumstances, the Executive, in the exercise of its 
discretion, and where an applicant consents to that course of action, 
may direct that an assessment is carried out within a different functional 
area of the Executive.”
text_norm: 8 principal regulation hereby amended insertion following regulation regulation 8 - notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 28th december 2021 704 3 8a (1) executive cause assessment applicant commenced executive shall direct assessment carried within relevant functional area (2) exceptional circumstance executive exercise discretion applicant consent course action may direct assessment carried within different functional area executive

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 9. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the
text_raw:
9. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the 

following Regulation after Regulation 16 – 

“Eligibility for services 

16A. (1) An applicant shall be eligible to receive services under the 
Health Acts 1947 to 2004 in the relevant functional area. 
(2) An applicant shall not be eligible to receive services under the 
Health Acts 1947 to 2004 outside the relevant functional area save for 
in exceptional circumstances, when the liaison officer may, at his or her 
discretion, consider whether such services should be delivered to the 
applicant outside the relevant functional area.”
text_norm: 9 principal regulation hereby amended insertion following regulation regulation 16 - eligibility service 16a (1) applicant shall eligible receive service health act 1947 2004 relevant functional area (2) applicant shall eligible receive service health act 1947 2004 outside relevant functional area save exceptional circumstance liaison officer may discretion consider whether service delivered applicant outside relevant functional area

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: 10. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the
text_raw:
10. The Principal Regulations are hereby amended by the insertion of the 

following Regulation after Regulation 19 – 

“19A. (1) In arranging with the person or persons charged with 
delivering the services specified in the service statement, a liaison 
officer shall provide that services will be delivered to an applicant in 
the relevant functional area. 

(2) In exceptional circumstances, the liaison officer in consultation 
with the Executive, in the exercise of their discretion, may with the 
consent of an applicant arrange for the delivery of services to the 
applicant outside the relevant functional area.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 December, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [704]
text_norm: 10 principal regulation hereby amended insertion following regulation regulation 19 - 19a (1) arranging person person charged delivering service specified service statement liaison officer shall provide service delivered applicant relevant functional area (2) exceptional circumstance liaison officer consultation executive exercise discretion may consent applicant arrange delivery service applicant outside relevant functional area given official seal 13 december 2021 stephen donnelly minister health 4 704

title: conferred on me by section 21 of the Disability Act 2005, hereby make the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations provide for consequential amendments to S.I. No. 263 of 
2007 and will allow for the carrying out and management of applications for 
Assessments of Need by the HSE in chronological order based on the 
applicant’s home address and will ensure that any assessment and interventions 
identified are provided as close as possible to the applicant’s home address. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [704] 5
